description: The reality star, 33, looked decidedly down in the dumps as she took her gleaming new Porsche 911 for a spin near her home in Essex on Tuesday.
title: Chantelle Houghton takes her new Porsche out for a spin
title_page: Chantelle Houghton takes her new Porsche out for a spin | Daily Mail Online
text:
She's just become the proud owner of the sort of car most can only dream of.
But Chantelle Houghton looked decidedly down in the dumps as she took her gleaming new Porsche 911 for a spin near her home in Essex on Tuesday.
The reality star, 33, made sure all eyes were on her as she rocked up to a local petrol station to fill up her luxury new purchase - with a price tag of a whopping £90,000 - but her lavish spending failed to raise a smile.
Scroll down for video
Cheer up! Chantelle Houghton looked decidedly down in the dumps as she took her gleaming new Porsche 911 for a spin near her home in Essex on Tuesday
The former Celebrity Big Brother winner seemed downcast while she made a pit-stop to tend to her vehicle's needs.
Chantelle sported a dressed down look for the occasion and was seen making her way back to her car in a pair of grey skinny jeans.
She teamed her wardrobe staple with a Balmain Paris designer tee and a trendy pair of trainers, while covering up from the winter chill in a leather biker jacket.
The mother-of-one - who shares daughter Dolly, four, with ex partner Alex Reid - made sure to inject a little glamour into her ensemble with a full face of heavy make-up.
Hot wheels: The reality star, 33, made sure all eyes were on her as she rocked up to a local petrol station to fill up her luxury new purchase, with a price tag of a whopping £90,000 -
Vroom vroom: The former Celebrity Big Brother winner seemed downcast while she made a pit-stop to tend to her vehicle's needs
She was seen sweeping her chocolate hued tresses back from her face, while juggling her new car keys with a bottle of water, her purse and a packet of mints.
Despite appearing a little low, Chantelle's mood soon lifted as she got the engine going on her Porsche.
Settling back into the driver's seat, the TV personality donned a huge pair of shades and was caught beaming with delight as she purred along in her flashy motor.
It may have cost Chantelle more than a small fortune, but she has been known to live by the motto 'life is too short'.
'Life is too short': The brunette beauty took on Tina Malone in debate about weight affecting a person's happiness on This Morning in February
Back in February, the brunette beauty appeared on This Morning to take part in a debate, alongside Tina Malone, about weight.
Chantelle has openly spoken about her own battles with her figure, after ballooning from a size 10 to 16 in 2015, and insisted she is content no matter what her size may be.
While Tina argued that she is happy now because of her slim figure, Chantelle said she is more open minded when it comes to her weight and her self-esteem.
She hit back: 'I've been up and down all my life with my weight and life is really short. I just want to enjoy my life.'
Chantelle also shared her views on bodyshamers and insisted to make cruel jibes about a person's size is 'disgusting' behaviour.
'I think we should all get on with our lives and ignore them,' she fired. 'I truly don't care what trolls say. I think the bodyshaming thing is disgusting.'
